intro: Webera compactiflora, commonly known as the compact-flowered webera, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and broad, lobed leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white, blooming during the rainy season. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
